Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid in Surgically Treated Intracerebral Hemorrhage Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial randomized 2325 participants

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with acute ICH admitted within 8 hours of stroke symptom onset.

Intervention.evidence: randomized 2325 participants with acute ICH to receive either TXA or placebo

Objective.evidence: This post hoc analysis examines whether TXA reduces the need for neurosurgery and improves outcomes in surgically treated patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the frequency of neurosurgery within 7 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events, including seizures, were more common in surgically treated participants

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by the National Institute for Health Research.
